text:
any idea when the boilerplate social media module / icons might support X? i'm getting tons of pushback about the twitter bird needing to be GONE from sites, and i really don't want to reinvent the wheel on a module that actually works really well otherwise.

anyone have any good workarounds?
I would do a quick patch with your main stylesheet to swap out the icon. Then once the module is updated you can remove your patch. That should end the squawking for a short bit. :duck:

can you clarify where i would patch the SVG in my main stylesheet? the module uses an icon picker from a library that's not in my files center and renders the svg onto the page. it's not a background png or anything like that,

maybe i have to bite the bullet and replace it using js.......
I was going to suggest replacing it with JS
That would work also
Is there a parent class around the svg you can select?
well there will have to be, somehow, to grab it with js.......
<@UDEASNWEB> if i recall correctly, the font awesome library is now updated to version 6, maybe its in there?
i saw it in the changelog yesterday
i don't see fontawesome called in the boilerplate; i'll check again
and if it's installed in HubSpot, i looked for both x and twitter in the module's icon selector an hour ago and no x
its installed
look for "x-twitter"
"The Icon field now supports Font Awesome 6.4.2"
<https://fontawesome.com/icons/x-twitter?f=brands&s=solid>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/october-2023-rollup>
okay where am i going wrong
do you need to select the version first?
ahh, no i think the problem is that its not the Icon Field but the Social follow, that might still be on version 5.xx
that sounds right
i'm in the social follow module selecting "custom icon" and there is no x
there are 3 old school twitter icons
twitter still defaults to the bird icon, i tried changing that to x-twitter in the code but it came up blank
and yes <@UBT0AHWLD> this is the social follow module included in the boilerplate
Hey everyone :wave: we have a PR up for this in boilerplate over <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/pull/495|here> if helpful

Note that changing the value for Twitter in the dropdown select "Social account field" from `twitter` to `x-twitter` will change the value of the selection for pre-existing assets so you may need to slightly modify if this is being changed on an existing site but it should provide a good idea of getting the most up to date icon (e.g. you could keep the value as `twitter` and add a conditional similar to whats app)
Thanks, I think we're looking at different things. I'm looking at the social follow in the boilerplate, and there is no account for x-twitter there.
<@UDEASNWEB> just to confirm - are you talking about <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/tree/main/src/modules/social-follow.module|this module> in the boilerplate?

> Note that changing the value for Twitter in the dropdown select “Social account field” from `twitter` to `x-twitter` will change the value of the selection for pre-existing assets so you may need to slightly modify if this is being changed on an existing site but it should provide a good idea of getting the most up to date icon (e.g. you could keep the value as `twitter` and add a conditional similar to whats app) (edited)
Keep in mind that you still need to convert this to `x twitter` (remove - ) when it is passed into the icon name attribute

```
{% icon ... name="x twitter" icon_set=""fontawesome-6.4.2"" ... %}```
Needs to be the final output if youre rolling this on it’s own

:bee: Hey there everyone :bee:
New <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/releases/tag/v3.14.0|boilerplate release>:
• Updates icon sets
• Updates twitter bird --> Twitter X on social follow module.
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CMXUWUY5D/p1698863973055669>
THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!

<@U26AKMZ19> - We were really excited reading about the new icon_set :partying_face: Thanks to HubSpot for adding it!!
I just did some testing and I think there is an issue for theme providers. If a theme updates the icon-set for existing customers, previously configured icons may disappear.
I think this is also what you are referring to above?
> Note that changing the value for Twitter in the dropdown select “Social account field” from `twitter` to `x-twitter` will change the value of the selection for pre-existing assets so you may need to slightly modify if this is being changed on an existing site but it should provide a good idea of getting the most up to date icon (e.g. you could keep the value as `twitter` and add a conditional similar to whats app) (edited)
I’ve read that FontAwesome 6 is downward compatible, but the HubSpot implementation seems not to be.
How can a theme provider deal with this situation? We get a lot of support tickets regarding Twitters X icon. Do you have any tips or info about that?

<@UHDEVB0S1> The intended use above for the boilerplate is that it is a starting point for creating new themes. It should be fine that the default is the new 6.4.2 icon set.

If you are looking to retroactively adjust and apply in your own themes you might have to add some logic to swap between older versions of <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields#icon|FA icon sets> and set appropriate names on the fly based on what a user selects. (If your approaching this from a select dropdown standpoint like in the social follow module)

<@UQWGKUEN7> / <@U26AKMZ19> - Ok, got you! Thank you very much for the feedback. We will add an additional dropdown field that allows the user to select wich version of the icon_set they would like to use.
It would be cleaner to map the icon name though, we’ll see.
<https://fontawesome.com/docs/web/setup/upgrade/whats-changed#icons-renamed-in-version-6>

Thanks for sharing that — we are looking into some solutions :slightly_smiling_face: (pending discussions — would still advise the interim fix of selecting an icon set dropdown if you need something ASAP)

I think there are also mappings for the unicodes. 
From my perspective the optimal solution would be if the mapping is taken care of within the icon tag to avoid downward compatibility issues.
Thank you very much for considering/discussing this :pray:
